Articles.Content:
Ok, so here I\'m approaching Mun.

In the first screenshot you can see that it predicts that my ship will make a sharp 90deg turn.

Screenshot 2 - almost there.

Screenshot 3 - Yes, i\'m now travelling in the predicted direction.

Sorry if I don\'t find this believable. I don\'t think it\'s possible for objects to suddenly, completely, change direction when under the influence of of gravity-wells.

The encounter of another body in space should happen gradually.

Am I wrong?

The yellow means what your orbit will look like in *relation* to the object\'s SOI you will get within, so when you enter, your general velocity will not severely change in an unrealistic matter.

Could someone make a .gif for this purpose?
Alternatively, for a more intuitive (for some) view, you might try changing the Patched Conics display mode in settings.cfg (i think the default is 1; try 2 or 0)
The Mun will continue to move. If you were to map your position relative to Kerbin it would look better.

Deleted

**Edited <time datetime="2023-04-24T21:55:50Z" title="04/24/2023 09:55  PM" data-short="1 yr">April 24, 2023</time> by BSOM180**

Remember that the Mun/moon is moving around Kerbin while you move around it. Basically, as you travel around the Mun, that yellow line shows your trajectory when including the Mun\'s velocity around Kerbin.
In your settings.cfg file, change the CONIC\_PATCH\_DRAW\_MODE = 0 to CONIC\_PATCH\_DRAW\_MODE = 3. Should be a bit easier to interpret.
